{"step_by_step_thinking": "Centric relation is the position of the mandible in which the condyles articulate with the thinnest avascular portion of their respective discs with the complex in the anterior-superior position against the slopes of the articular eminences. Freedom of centric relation refers to the ability of the mandible to move freely and comfortably to this position without any restrictions or interference. The range of freedom of centric relation is typically measured in millimeters. Based on this, the correct answer would be a range of millimeters.", "answer_choice": "C. 0.5 to 1.5 mm"}
